Description: A unique identifier assigned to each patient to ensure data privacy and enable tracking across multiple visits without revealing personal details.

Specifies the eye for which the drug was prescribed during each visit. If multiple records are tied to the same visit, the values are separated by semicolons (;). - 1: Right eye - 2: Left eye - 3: Both eyes
Example: Original Format: 1;1;3;3 Transformed Format (if split for clarity): - Record 1: 1 (Right eye) - Record 2: 1 (Right eye) - Record 3: 3 (Both eyes) - Record 4: 3 (Both eyes)

Description: The name of the medication prescribed during a single visit. Multiple drugs prescribed within the same visit are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: GATILOX DM-10ML; GATILOX DM-10ML; MISOPT EYE DROPS; P-NAC TABS Transformed Format: - Drug 1: GATILOX DM-10ML - Drug 2: GATILOX DM-10ML - Drug 3: MISOPT EYE DROPS - Drug 4: P-NAC TABS

Description: Duration for which the prescribed drug is to be used. If multiple records are tied to the same visit, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: 7 days;10 days;14 days Transformed Format: - Record 1: 7 days - Record 2: 10 days - Record 3: 14 days

Description: Frequency of drug administration during a visit. Multiple frequencies in a single visit are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: 4 times a day;Morning only;Evening only Transformed Format: - Record 1: 4 times a day - Record 2: Morning only - Record 3: Evening only

Description: Indicates whether the drug should be taken before or after meals during a visit. Multiple records in a single visit are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Before Meals;After Meals;After Meals Transformed Format: - Record 1: Before Meals - Record 2: After Meals - Record 3: After Meals

Description: The start date for the prescribed medication. Multiple records for a single visit are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: 2023-01-01;2023-02-01;2023-03-01 Transformed Format: - Record 1: 2023-01-01 - Record 2: 2023-02-01 - Record 3: 2023-03-01

Description: Description of the drug dosage, such as "1 drop" or "1 tablet". Multiple records for the same visit are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: 1 drop;1 tablet;2 drops Transformed Format: - Record 1: 1 drop - Record 2: 1 tablet - Record 3: 2 drops

Description: Specifies the eye for which the diagnosis was made during each visit. If multiple visits are recorded in a single patient record, the values are separated by semicolons (;). Each value corresponds to one visit: - 1: Right eye - 2: Left eye - 3: Both eyes.
Example: Original Format: 3;3;3;0;3;1 Transformed Format: - Records1: 3 - Records2: 3 - Records3: 3 - Records4: 0 - Records5: 3 - Records6: 1

Description: The diagnosis or medical condition identified during the patient's visit. If multiple diagnoses are recorded for a single patient across visits, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: CSCR- Central Serous Chorio Retinopathy; S/P Focal Laser; Glaucoma Suspect; Hypertension; S/P Intravitreal Injection; CNVM- Choroidal neovascular membrane Transformed Format: - Record 1: CSCR- Central Serous Chorio Retinopathy - Record 2: S/P Focal Laser - Record 3: Glaucoma Suspect - Record 4: Hypertension - Record 5: S/P Intravitreal Injection - Record 6: CNVM- Choroidal neovascular membrane

Description: The department or specialty clinic the patient Recorded, such as Retina Clinic or Glaucoma Clinic. If multiple Records are recorded in the same patient record, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Retina Clinic;Glaucoma Clinic;Retina Clinic Transformed Format: - Records1: Retina Clinic - Records2: Glaucoma Clinic - Records3: Retina Clinic

Description: The diagnostic tests, scans, or procedures performed during the patient's visit, such as Optical Coherence Tomography or blood tests. If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Optical Coherence Tomography;Blood Test;OCT Scan Transformed Format: - Records1: Optical Coherence Tomography - Records2: Blood Test - Records3: OCT Scan

Description: The symptoms or issues reported by the patient during their visit, such as pain, redness, or defective vision. If multiple visits are recorded in a single patient record, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Pain;Redness;Defective Vision Transformed Format: - Records1: Pain - Records2: Redness - Records3: Defective Vision

Description: Indicates whether the patient wears glasses: Yes or No. If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;) indicating multiple records for the same visit.
Example: Original Format: Yes;No;Yes Transformed Format: - Records1: Yes - Records2: No - Records3: Yes

Description: Specifies the duration for which the patient has been using their current pair of glasses, e.g., "1 year", "2 years". If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: 1 year;2 years;3 months Transformed Format: - Records1: 1 year - Records2: 2 years - Records3: 3 months

Description: Visual acuity measurement for the right eye (RE). If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: 6/6;6/12;6/36 Transformed Format: - Records1: 6/6 - Records2: 6/12 - Records3: 6/36

Description: Visual acuity measurement for the left eye (LE). If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: 6/6;6/24;6/60 Transformed Format: - Records1: 6/6 - Records2: 6/24 - Records3: 6/60

Description: Observations or findings related to the eyelid of the left eye. If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Normal;Edema;Ptosis Transformed Format: - Records1: Normal - Records2: Edema - Records3: Ptosis

Description: Observations or findings related to the eyelid of the right eye. If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Normal;Ptosis;Blepharitis Transformed Format: - Records1: Normal - Records2: Ptosis - Records3: Blepharitis

Description: Observations of the conjunctiva (the thin membrane covering the white part of the eye) of the right eye. If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Clear;Inflamed;Irritated Transformed Format: - Records1: Clear - Records2: Inflamed - Records3: Irritated

Description: Observations of the conjunctiva of the left eye. If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Clear;Irritated;Inflamed Transformed Format: - Records1: Clear - Records2: Irritated - Records3: Inflamed

Description: Findings related to the cornea of the right eye. If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Clear;Scarring;Edema Transformed Format: - Records1: Clear - Records2: Scarring - Records3: Edema

Description: Findings related to the cornea of the left eye. If multiple visits are recorded, the values are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Clear;Edema;Scarring Transformed Format: - Records1: Clear - Records2: Edema - Records3: Scarring

Description: Observations of the anterior chamber (the fluid-filled space between the cornea and iris) of the right eye. If multiple values are recorded, they are separated by semicolons (;), indicating repeated assessments during a visit.
Example: Original Format: Normal Depth;Shallow Depth;Normal Depth Transformed Format: - Records1: Normal Depth - Records2: Shallow Depth - Records3: Normal Depth

Description: Observations of the anterior chamber of the left eye. If multiple values are recorded, they are separated by semicolons (;), indicating repeated assessments during a visit.
Example: Original Format: Normal Depth;Cells Present;Shallow Depth Transformed Format: - Records1: Normal Depth - Records2: Cells Present - Records3: Shallow Depth

Description: Describes findings related to the retina or optic disc of the right eye. If multiple findings are recorded, they are separated by semicolons (;), indicating multiple observations during the same visit.
Example: Original Format: 0.7CDR;Bayonetting;Edema Transformed Format: - Records1: 0.7CDR - Records2: Bayonetting - Records3: Edema

Description: Describes findings related to the retina or optic disc of the left eye. If multiple findings are recorded, they are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: 0.6CDR;Pigmented Lesion;Normal Transformed Format: - Records1: 0.6CDR - Records2: Pigmented Lesion - Records3: Normal

Description: Observations of blood vessels in the retina of the right eye. If multiple observations are recorded, they are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Normal;Dilated;Tortuous Transformed Format: - Records1: Normal - Records2: Dilated - Records3: Tortuous

Description: Observations of blood vessels in the retina of the left eye. If multiple observations are recorded, they are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Normal;Dilated;Narrowed Transformed Format: - Records1: Normal - Records2: Dilated - Records3: Narrowed

Description: Describes the background findings in the retina of the right eye, such as scars, lesions, or pigmentation. If multiple findings are recorded, they are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: Pigmented Lesion;Macular Scar;Normal Transformed Format: - Records1: Pigmented Lesion - Records2: Macular Scar - Records3: Normal

Description: Describes the background findings in the retina of the left eye, such as scars, lesions, or pigmentation. If multiple findings are recorded, they are separated by semicolons (;).
Example: Original Format: RPE Lesion;Laser Scars;Normal Transformed Format: - Records1: RPE Lesion - Records2: Laser Scars - Records3: Normal
